intro: Heisteria krukovii, commonly known as the Krukovii's heisteria, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
